com.avalancheevantage.android.camera3

Class Camera3

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.avalancheevantage.android.camera3.Camera3

  • public final class Camera3
extends java.lang.Object
    Camera3 is a wrapper around the Android Camera2 API. It is an attempt to provide a single simple and safe interface to the notoriously bad Android Camera2 API.

    It is adapted from the Camera2Basic Google Sample at https://github.com/googlesamples/android-Camera2Basic

    • Constructor Detail

      • Camera3

        public Camera3(@NonNull
               android.content.Context context,
               @Nullable
               ErrorHandler errorHandler)
        Creates a new Camera3 manager instance. Only one such manager should have to exist per Activity. Many different preview sessions, capture sessions, and capture requests can exist for one Camera3 object.
        Parameters:
        context - The context from which to access the camera. Should usually just be the current activity
        errorHandler - An ErrorHandler to handle any errors that arise over the lifetime

                                PreviewHandler previewHandler,
                                @Nullable
                                java.util.List<StillCaptureHandler> stillCaptureSessions)
        See Also:

      • startCaptureSession

        public void startCaptureSession(@NonNull
                                java.lang.String cameraId,
                                @Nullable
                                PreviewHandler previewHandler,
                                @Nullable
                                java.util.List<StillCaptureHandler> stillCaptureSessions,
                                @Nullable
                                java.util.List<VideoCaptureHandler> videoCaptureHandlers)
        See Also:
        startCaptureSession(String, PreviewHandler, List, List, Runnable)

      • startCaptureSession

        public void startCaptureSession(@NonNull
                                java.lang.String cameraId,
                                @Nullable
                                PreviewHandler previewHandler,
                                @Nullable
                                java.util.List<StillCaptureHandler> stillCaptureHandlers,
                                @Nullable
                                java.util.List<VideoCaptureHandler> videoCaptureHandlers,
                                @Nullable
                                java.lang.Runnable onSessionStarted)
        Starts a new session. Only one session can be open at a time.
        Parameters:
        cameraId - which camera to use (from getAvailableCameras()).
        previewHandler - an object representing the configuration for the camera preview, or null to not show a preview (see PreviewHandler).
        stillCaptureHandlers - a list of zero or more StillCaptureHandler's, or null if no still images will be captured. Usually only one is required.
        videoCaptureHandlers - a list of zero or more VideoCaptureHandler's, or null if no video will be recorded. Usually a maximum of one is required.
        onSessionStarted - an optional callback that will be called to notify the user when the camera has been opened and the capture session has been started.
        See Also:
        PreviewHandler, StillCaptureHandler, VideoCaptureHandler

      • resume

        public void resume()
        See Also:
        resume(Runnable)

      • resume

        public void resume(@Nullable
                   java.lang.Runnable onSessionRestarted)

        Resumes the capture session established by the last call to startCaptureSession(String, PreviewHandler, List)

        If you're not sure if startCaptureSession(String, PreviewHandler, List) has been called already or not, you can check with captureConfigured()

        Parameters:
        onSessionRestarted - an optional callback that will be called to notify the user when the camera has been opened and the capture session has been restarted.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Stops background threads and frees the camera.

        pause must be called in Activity.onPause() form the activity that started the session. Otherwise, the app could close without relinquishing control of the camera.

      • setCaptureResultListener

        public void setCaptureResultListener(@Nullable
                                     CaptureResultListener listener)
        Registers a listener to be updated whenever Camera3 gets a result from the camera. This is useful for keeping track of what state the camera is in (e.g. if you want to play a sound when the capture is completed). Note: this is NOT the way you receive the result of the capture (i.e. an image). For that, use the OnImageAvailableListener in StillCaptureHandler.StillCaptureHandler(int, Size, OnImageAvailableListener)
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to register or null to stop listening

      • startVideoCapture

        public void startVideoCapture(@NonNull
                              VideoCaptureHandler handler,
                              @Nullable
                              java.io.File outputFile,
                              @Nullable
                              VideoCaptureStartedCallback callback)
        Asyncronously requests to start capturing video
        Parameters:
        handler - the handler responsible for configuring and writing the video
        outputFile - the file where the video will be saved, or null to write to a temp file
        callback - a callback function to be called when the video capture has been started

      • stopVideoCapture

        public void stopVideoCapture(@NonNull
                             VideoCaptureHandler handler)
        Stops video recording. Video recording must have already started.

        Note: the starting video recording is asyncronous so if you stop immediately after you stop this method may cause an IllegalStateException

        Parameters:
        handler - the handler that is currently recording video

      • captureImage

        public void captureImage(@NonNull
                         StillCaptureHandler handler,
                         @Nullable
                         CaptureRequestConfiguration precapture,
                         @NonNull
                         CaptureRequestConfiguration capture)
        Starts the process of capturing a still image from the camera. Should be called after calling startCaptureSession(String, PreviewHandler, List)
        Parameters:
        handler - the StillCaptureHandler which will be responsible for processing the image
        precapture - the precapture configuration. Use PRECAPTURE_CONFIG_TRIGGER_AUTO_EXPOSE to trigger auto focus prior to the image capture or use PRECAPTURE_CONFIG_NONE to skip precapture (and use the preview focus). This will speed up the capture process.
        capture - the configuration for the actual image capture (on top of the defaults). Use CAPTURE_CONFIG_DEFAULT if you don't want to change the default configuration at all.

      • getErrorHandler

        @Contract(pure=true)
public ErrorHandler getErrorHandler()

      • captureConfigured

        @Contract(pure=true)
public boolean captureConfigured()
        It is only safe to call resume() if you have already configured a capture session with startCaptureSession(String, PreviewHandler, List, List, Runnable). This method allows you to check that status.
        Returns:
        true if this instance of camera3 is configured with a capture session

      • isStarted

        @Contract(pure=true)
public boolean isStarted()
        Images can only be captured between calling resume() or startCaptureSession(String, PreviewHandler, List, List, Runnable) and calling pause(). This method allows you to check whether the camera can receive requests. If this is false, you can call resume().
        Returns:
        true if the camera can receive requests

      • requestsInQueue

        @Contract(pure=true)
public boolean requestsInQueue()
        Check if there are any enqueued requests that have not yet been resolved
        Returns:
        true if the request queue is not empty.

      • getAvailableImageSizes

        @NonNull
public java.util.List<android.util.Size> getAvailableImageSizes(@NonNull
                                                                          java.lang.String cameraId,
                                                                          int format)
        Get all supported image sizes for the given image format and camera
        Parameters:
        cameraId - the id of the camera form getAvailableCameras()
        format - one of ImageFormat
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable Collection of all the supported sizes

      • getLargestAvailableImageSize

        @Nullable
public android.util.Size getLargestAvailableImageSize(java.lang.String cameraId,
                                                                 int imageFormat)
        Gets the largest image dimensions (by area) that the given camera is able to take in the given format
        Parameters:
        cameraId - the id of the camera form getAvailableCameras()
        imageFormat - one of ImageFormat
        Returns:
        the largest Size if one exists or null if the camera does not offer any sizes for the given format
        See Also:
        getAvailableImageSizes(String, int)

      • getDefaultVideoSize

        public android.util.Size getDefaultVideoSize(@NonNull
                                             java.lang.String cameraId)
        Get a recommended video size at a reasonable aspect ratio and size. Chooses form getAvailableVideoSizes(String)
        Parameters:
        cameraId - the id of the camera form getAvailableCameras()
        Returns:
        the best available video size or null if the camera does not support any video sizes

      • saveImage

        public void saveImage(android.media.Image image,
                      java.io.File file)
        A utility method to asynchronously save an image file. The caller must obtain permission to write to external storage (if necessary) before calling this method.
        Parameters:
        image - the image to save
        file - the file to write to
